answers.answer: Have you been counting your kicks?

My little girl kicks a lot less at 37 weeks. There is less room in there. If your baby isn't meeting the 10 kicks in two hours you should call your doctor or go in. She went 24 hours, after a night of intense false labor, without really moving. They had me go in for monitoring and she was fine. I was happy to be safe than sorry though.
Well Right For About Ten Minutes I've Felt more than 15 moves or maybe more but than he will stop fora couple hours and than go again

They shouldn't move less..they start to run out of room so it shld be more of rolling movements. Do you feel just more rolling or moving more then kicks? If so that's totally normal:) if u can't feel any kind of movement then I wld call your doctor and let them know!

Remember ur baby is growing n its getting less room to move much.  So u most likely wouldn't feel as much movement as earlier but do ur kick counts as well n if ur really not feeling anything i would go check that out
I don't feel kicks but I do feel Him rolling and moving
Thats a good thing! But to ease ur mind u cld always call your doctor:)
I Did They Have No Appointment So Ima Just Gonna Head Too The Hospital Cuz My Stomach Hurting Really Bad

When i was 34 weeks i noticed my daughter not kicking or moving at all so i went to my drs office and it turned out that i had severe preeclampsia and i had to be induced. So i do suggest getting checked out because it could be something serious and you would never know!
What is that if you don't mind me asking
I am praying! Keep us posted!
Doctors have told me that our baby should not move any less when is are farther along. You may not feel kicks but more of rolling and bulging out , that's still movement.

It's very dangerous to be listening to advise that says babys stop moving or move less because they are having a lazy day or because they run out of room. This is simply NOT true. You know your own babies patterns, if you notice a reduction get checked straight away.

question: Should I Be Concerned If I'm 35 Weeks And 2 Days And My Son Moving Less But I feel Him Should I Be Worried
title: QUESTION
